words.defineEn: to agree with or correspond to something
words.defineVi: để đồng ý với hoặc tương ứng với một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to be in agreement with something; to correspond to something
words.defineVi: đồng ý với điều gì đó; để tương ứng với một cái gì đó

examples: They collaborate with other students on group projects.
Engineers collaborate with architects to turn design concepts into reality.
They laughed, shared ideas, and collaborated effortlessly, always staying on friendly terms.
We attend conferences, read and write journals, and collaborate with other trainers.
After a disagreement, the team is working to get back on the rails and collaborate effectively to achieve their shared goals.
words.defineEn: to work with someone else in order to create something or reach the same goal
words.defineVi: để làm việc với người khác để tạo ra một cái gì đó hoặc đạt được cùng một mục tiêu

examples: A supportive and inclusive work environment can breed creativity and collaboration among employees.
Instead of hiring the brightest scientists and locking them in an ivory tower with like-minded people, the organization strives to embrace collaboration and a full-stack scope of solutions.
The decision to allow employees to work from home cuts both ways, as it can increase flexibility and productivity but can also lead to reduced collaboration and communication.
And ideological purity had replaced collaboration.
In healthcare, collaboration is really important.
words.defineEn: the act or process of working with someone to produce or achieve something
words.defineVi: hành động hoặc quá trình làm việc với ai đó để sản xuất hoặc đạt được điều gì đó

examples: Fire ants, meanwhile, have a more collaborative attack strategy.
These are major collaborative efforts.
It's really a collaborative show.
Through the EU science programs, the European countries became a collaborative engine that serves as a hub of science in the wider world.
Language is the world's greatest collaborative project, and we're all participating in it every day!
words.defineEn: involving or done by two or more parties working together toward a shared goal

examples: So, we need collective help from the national government.

But when Hulse and Taylor published their results in 1975, the astronomy world lost its collective mind.
This is an initiative, a collective.
Each league sets through the collective bargaining agreement with player unions.
words.defineEn: involving, done, or shared by all members of a group
words.defineVi: liên quan, thực hiện hoặc chia sẻ bởi tất cả các thành viên của một nhóm

examples: People talk about collusion: Did Trump collude with Russia?
Or we were saying that they are colluding.
Some would say collude to set rules and practices that protect the industry from themselves, that protect themselves jointly from new competition.
Do you believe that it will produce proof that this president colluded in some way with the Russians?
And if they have a formal agreement to collude, we call these players right over here, we call them a cartel.
words.defineEn: ‌to cooperate secretly or illegally for deceiving other people
words.defineVi: ‌hợp tác bí mật hoặc bất hợp pháp để lừa dối người khác

examples: Russian collusion, give me a break.
It said no collusion

words.defineVi: thỏa thuận bí mật được thực hiện đặc biệt để đánh lừa mọi người

examples: The two neighbors mend fences by discussing their concerns and finding common ground.
After a heated debate, the politicians realized the importance of building bridges and finding common ground for the benefit of the nation.

If you are dealing with a difficult or angry person, it's important to listen to their concerns and try to find common ground, rather than getting defensive or confrontational, as pouring oil on the fire is not the way to quench it.
And he found common ground with the democrats on this issue.
And that common ground was shrinking dramatically.
words.defineEn: shared opinions, beliefs, or interests between parties that have disagreements about other things
words.defineVi: chia sẻ ý kiến, niềm tin hoặc lợi ích giữa các bên có bất đồng về những thứ khác

examples: The compliant media never asked them about.
But he’s compliant and friendly throughout this time.
Maybe she's more, shall we say, compliant.
Guatemala was less compliant, and its president has been blunt.
Privacy.com is PCI DSS compliant, uses military grade encryption to secure information and offers two-factor authentication.
words.defineEn: willingly obeying rules or doing what other people demand
words.defineVi: sẵn sàng tuân theo các quy tắc hoặc làm những gì người khác yêu cầu

examples: Despite the pressure to conform, she chose to do her own thing and started her own business, which became a great success.
Despite his unconventional ideas, John knew that it is ill striving against the stream and decided to conform to the company's dress code.
First of all, the brain conforms to the shape of the skull, not the other way around.
- You can conform or confirm.
In claws, the bed of keratinocytes conforms to a narrow finger bone, wrapping around the end of the digit and radiating outwards to form a cone-shaped structure.
words.defineEn: to think or act similar to most people in a particular society or group

words.defineEn: the act of following or obeying the rules of something particular

examples: But Divine Right theory also meant religious conformity.
Now, this is different from conformity.

words.defineEn: behavior that corresponds to socially accepted rules
words.defineVi: hành vi tương ứng với các quy tắc được xã hội chấp nhận

words.defineEn: compatibility or agreement
words.defineVi: tương thích hoặc thỏa thuận

examples: Consonant cluster reduction, where multiple continents at the end of a word are simplified into one.

examples: The new sofa wouldn't fit into the small living room.
